alert.note: Alert for Northeast Highlands (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flash Flood Watch issued June 25 at 3:51AM MDT until June 26 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WATCH FOR THE NORTHEAST HIGHLANDS IN EFFECT FROM 2 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH SUNDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...The potential exists for flash flooding due to showers and thunderstorms with locally heavy rainfall this afternoon and evening, then persistent moderate rainfall late tonight through Sunday. * WHERE...A portion of northeast New Mexico, including the following area, Northeast Highlands. * WHEN...From 2 PM MDT this afternoon through Sunday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Over 2 inches of rain is forecast for the Las Vegas, New Mexico area with locally heavier amounts possible. In addition, heavy runoff is forecast to move through the area from the Hermits Peak/Calf Canyon Burn Scar. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - National Weather Service Meteorologists are forecasting heavy rainfall over the area, which may lead to flash flooding. Debris flows will also be possible below burn scars. - http://www.weather.gov/abq/EmergencyPrepFlood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued. Local emergency services are monitoring the situation and will issue a public statement as conditions warrant. PLAN NOW so you will know what to do in an emergency. Keep informed by listening to local radio and television for statements and possible warnings. Follow the advice of public safety officials.
